post.summary: Queries the resolved dynamic form fields configurations that match the request.

get.summary: Gets the resolved dynamic form fields configuration by ID.
Gets the list of accessible dynamic form fields configurations.

parameters.name: Take
parameters.description: Optional. The maximum number of entities to return.

parameters.name: ContinuationToken
parameters.description:
Optional. A token which allows the user to resume a GET request at the next entity in the accessible set.
When querying for entities, a token will be returned if a GET may
be continued. To obtain the next page of entities, pass the token to the
service on a subsequent GET requests.

parameters.name: ReturnCount
parameters.description:
Optional. Whether to return the total number of accessible entities,
disregarding the take value.

key.description:
Key to the filter
Specifies the key in the body object that corresponds to the filter.

expression.description:
Filter expression
A custom filter expression that will be appended to the body filter in
case the user provides input through the nimble-select filter field.

columns.description: The names and order of the columns included in the data frame.

data.description:
The data for each row with the order specified in the columns property.
Must contain a value for each column in the columns property.

DataFrame.description:
Data read from or to be written to a table. Values may be encoded as a string in a format according
to each column's datatype:
            
- INT32: Any integer number in the range [-2147483648, 2147483647], surrounded by quotes.
            
- INT64: Any integer number in the range [-9223372036854775808, 9223372036854775807], surrounded by quotes.
            
- FLOAT32: A decimal number using a period for the decimal point, optionally in scientific
notation, in the range [-3.40282347E+38, 3.40282347E+38], surrounded by quotes. Not all values
within the range can be represented with 32 bits. To preserve the exact binary encoding of
the value when converting to a string, clients should serialize 9 digits after the decimal.
Instead of a number, the value may be `"NaN"` (not a number), `"Infinity"` (positive infinity),
or `"-Infinity"` (negative infinity), case-sensitive.
            
- FLOAT64: A decimal number using a period for the decimal point, optionally in scientific
notation, in the range [-1.7976931348623157E+308, 1.7976931348623157E+308], surrounded by quotes.
Not all values within the range can be represented with 64 bits. To preserve the exact binary
encoding of the value when converting to a string, clients should serialize 17 digits after the
decimal. Instead of a number, the value may be `"NaN"` (not a number), `"Infinity"` (positive
infinity), or `"-Infinity"` (negative infinity), case-sensitive.
            
- STRING: Any quoted string, escaped as required by JSON.
            
The format is the same as a serialized Pandas DataFrame with `orient="split"` and `index=False`.
See https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.to_json.html.

DynamicFormConfiguration.description:
A specification for a dynamic form field configuration for a resource type within a workspace.
All referenced objects (groups, fields) are identified by their key and must belong to the same workspace.

configurations.description: A list of configurations to be added.

groups.description: A list of groups to be added.

fields.description: A list of fields to be added.

DynamicFormConfigurationCreateRequest.description:
A request to create a dynamic form field configuration.
You can create configurations, groups, and fields in a single request.
The objects reference each other by Key.

configurationIds.description: A list of dynamic form fields configuration IDs to delete.

groupIds.description: A list of dynamic form fields group IDs to delete.

fieldIds.description: A list of dynamic form field IDs to delete.

recursive.description:
Indicates whether to delete groups or fields that are children of the specified configurations or groups.
Children will be deleted only if they are not otherwise referenced.

unlinkFromParent.description:
Indicates whether to remove objects (groups, fields) from parents reference lists.
If false and a group or field is referenced by another group, deletion will fail.

DynamicFormConfigurationsDeleteRequest.description:
The request to delete a list of dynamic form field configurations.
You can include configurations, groups, and fields independently in a single request.
If Recursive is set, referenced children will be deleted. If children are referenced otherwise they will remain without blocking the parents deletion.
Use UnlinkFromParent to delete groups or fields and remove them from their parents reference lists. This is useful when a group or field is referenced by multiple parents.

configurations.description: A list of configurations to be updated.

groups.description: A list of groups to be updated.

fields.description: A list of fields to be updated.

deleteUnreferencedResources.description:
If true, groups and fields that are no longer referenced by another resource after the update request has been applied
will be deleted

DynamicFormField.description: A specification for a dynamic form field. Describes a user-configurable field that can be added to a form.

pageUrlTemplate.description: A relative template URL to build a link based on a single resource.

DynamicFormFieldLinkedResource.description: Represents a dynamic form field linked resource.

minValue.description:
The minimum value or length for the field.
If the field is FieldType.Number, the minimum value should be expressed as a double
and specifies the minimum value of the field.
If the field is FieldType.String, the minimum value should be expressed as a double
and specifies the minimum length of the field.
If the field is FieldType.DateTime, the minimum value should be expressed as a
strings in ISO 8601 format and specifies the minimum value of the field.

maxValue.description:
The maximum value or maximum length for the field.
If the field is FieldType.Number, the maximum value should be expressed as a double
and specifies the maximum value of the field.
If the field is FieldType.String, the maximum value should be expressed as a double
and specifies the maximum length of the field.
If the field is FieldType.DateTime, the maximum value should be expressed as a
strings in ISO 8601 format and specifies the maximum value of the field.

numberOfDecimalPlaces.description: The maximum number of decimal places for a number field.

DynamicFormFieldValidation.description: The validation rules for the field. Application of the validation rules depend on the field type.

visible.description: A boolean value indicating whether the group is visible or not.

retainWhenHidden.description: A boolean value indicating whether all fields in a group keep their values when hidden or not.

fields.description: A list of field keys that belong to the group.

DynamicFormGroup.description: A specification for a dynamic form field group. Groups are used to organize fields.

resourceType.description: Required. Indicates the resourceType for which configurations should be fetched.

workspaces.description: Optional. Indicates the workspaces for which the dynamic form field configurations should be fetched. If workspaces is null or empty, query for all configurations the user has access to

take.description: Optional. The maximum number of dynamic form field configurations to return.

continuationToken.description:
Optional. A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching configuration set.
When querying for dynamic form field configurations, a token will be returned if a query may
be continued. To obtain the next page of dynamic form field configurations, pass the token to the
service on a subsequent request.

returnCount.description:
Optional. Whether to return the total number of dynamic form field configurations which match the provided query,
disregarding the take value.

DynamicFormResolvedQueryRequest.description: Query request for dynamic form fields.

configurations.description: A list of configurations matching the query.

continuationToken.description:
A token which allows the user to resume this query at the next configuraiton item matching the query.
In order to continue paginating a query, pass this token to the service on a subsequent request.
The service will continue to respond with new continuation tokens on subsequent query request.
To paginate a set of configuraitons, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service, until this value is null.

totalCount.description: The number of configurations that match the query, if returnCount is true. This value is not present if returnCount is false.

DynamicFormResolvedQueryResponse.description: The response for a resolved query for dynamic form fields. Contains the resolved groups and the fields of the configurations within the groups.

workspace.description: The workspace that the resource owning the properties belongs to.

resourceType.description:
The type of the resource that the table properties belongs to.
Supported values: workorder:workorder, workorder:testplan, asset:asset, system:system or testmonitor:product.

resourceId.description: The unique ID of the resource.

keys.description:
Optional. Indicates the keys of the table properties to query.
If Keys is null or empty, query for all table properties of the resource.

take.description: Optional. The maximum number of table properties to return.

continuationToken.description:
Optional. A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching table property set.
When querying for table properties, a token will be returned if a query may
be continued. To obtain the next page of table properties, pass the token to the
service on a subsequent request.

returnCount.description:
Optional. Whether to return the total number of table properties which match the provided query,
disregarding the take value.

tables.description: A list of table properties matching the query.

continuationToken.description:
A token which allows the user to resume this query at the next table property matching the query.
In order to continue paginating a query, pass this token to the service on a subsequent request.
The service will continue to respond with new continuation tokens on subsequent query request.
To paginate a set of table properties, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service, until this value is null.

totalCount.description: The number of table properties that match the query, if returnCount is true. This value is not present if returnCount is false.

QueryTablePropertiesResponse.description: The response to a query for tables stored for a specific resource.

displayRule.description:
Display rule states if the configuration will be displayed in the UI.
Display rules are written in a Javascript expression notation. For rule evaluation fist class properties, custom properties and keywords can be used.
For more information about building display rules, visit: https://www.npmjs.com/package/eval-estree-expression
